macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Mixed on Friday with Light Holiday Trading
items.summary: Major US indexes closed slightly lower on Friday, December 26, 2025: S&P 500 down less than 0.1% to 6,929.94, Dow down less than 0.1% to 48,710.97, Nasdaq down 0.1% to 23,593.10, and Russell 2000 down 0.5% to 2,534.35 amid light volume. For the week, all indexes rose, with S&P 500 up 1.4% and year-to-date gains led by Nasdaq at 22.2%.

items.title: Wall Street Sets New Record Highs on Wednesday Before Friday Dip
items.summary: Major US indexes hit fresh record closes on Wednesday, December 26, 2025: S&P 500 up 0.32% to 6,932.05, Dow up 0.60% to 48,731.16, Nasdaq up 0.22% to 23,613.31, driven by large-cap strength.

items.title: US GDP Growth Beats Expectations at 4.3%, Easing Rate Cut Bets
items.summary: Third-quarter US GDP grew 4.3%, surpassing 3.2% consensus after delay from government shutdown, reducing near-term Fed rate cut expectations though markets still price two cuts by end-2026.

items.title: Nike Shares Surge 4.6% on Tim Cook's Personal Purchase
items.summary: Nike (NKE) rose 4.6% after Apple CEO Tim Cook disclosed buying the stock; Micron (MU) and Citigroup (C) also gained 3.8% and 1.8% to intraday highs.

items.title: Prudential Financial Rebounds on $1B Share Buyback Plan
items.summary: Prudential Financial (PRU) shares recovered after six-session decline, supported by a planned $1 billion share buyback starting 2026 amid stabilizing sentiment.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: BlackRock Transfers Over $100M in Bitcoin and Ethereum to Coinbase Amid $27B Crypto Options Expiry
items.summary: BlackRock deposited significant amounts of BTC and ETH, including 1,044 BTC and 7,557 ETH worth $114M, to Coinbase as over $27 billion in crypto options for BTC, ETH, SOL, and XRP expire, hinting at potential market volatility and sell-off.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Breaks Through $89,000 with 1.76% 24-Hour Gain
items.summary: BTC/USDT reached $89,018.9, up 1.76% in the last 24 hours, after earlier hitting above $89K and retracing to $87K, amid options expiry and large transfers.

items.title: Solana and Hyperliquid Lead 2025 Blockchain Revenue Generation
items.summary: Solana generated $1.3 billion in revenue this year, topping all chains, followed by Hyperliquid at $816 million, surpassing Ethereum's $524 million due to high throughput and execution focus.

items.title: $1 Billion in Bitcoin Moved in Massive Whale Transfers Within Minutes
items.summary: Blockchain trackers reported seven large transfers totaling over $1 billion in Bitcoin on December 26, sparking speculation on market impacts.

items.title: Crypto Adoption Exceeds 300 Million Consumers Worldwide in 2025
items.summary: Binance CEO reports global crypto users surpassed 300 million in 2025, with 130 million new consumers onboarded this year amid staggering market growth.

items.title: Pakistani Police Dismantle $60 Million Cryptocurrency Fraud Gang
items.summary: Authorities in Pakistan arrested members of a crypto investment scam involving approximately $60 million in fraudulent activities.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: MIT Researchers Develop 'Scientific Sandbox' for Evolving AI Vision Systems
items.summary: MIT researchers created a computational framework where embodied AI agents evolve eyes and vision over generations, showing navigation tasks lead to compound eyes like insects and object tasks produce camera-type eyes. This could guide novel sensor designs for robots and drones.

items.title: Google Releases Gemini 3 Flash for High-Speed AI Applications
items.summary: Google launched Gemini 3 Flash, a lightweight, fast model with Pro-grade reasoning outperforming Gemini 2.5 Pro on benchmarks like GPQA Diamond (90.4%) and MMMU Pro (81.2%), available via API for multimodal tasks.

items.title: Waymo Tests Gemini AI as In-Car Assistant in Robotaxis
items.summary: Waymo is integrating Google's Gemini AI chatbot as an in-car assistant for its robotaxis, revealed through a 1,200+ line system prompt in the mobile app code.

items.title: NIST and MITRE Partner on AI Defense for Critical Infrastructure
items.summary: NIST partners with MITRE on the AI Economic Security Center to develop AI tools protecting critical infrastructure like power plants and hospitals from cyberthreats, focusing on reliability and assurance testing.

items.title: Updated Singularity Predictions Shift to 2030 Amid Rapid AI Advances
items.summary: As of December 26, 2025, AI expert predictions for singularity arrival adjust to 2030 due to exponential progress in multimodal models, reasoning, and robotics integration like VLAMs.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Reveals Free Game for December 26: We Were Here Together
items.summary: Epic Games Store has officially announced We Were Here Together as its free game giveaway for December 26 as part of the ongoing 2025 holiday promotions.

items.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 First Season Launches with New Content
items.summary: Treyarch released the first seasonal update for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 on December 4, adding new maps, weapons, and modes to multiplayer and Zombies, amid ongoing post-launch support.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Unveils Exynos 2600, World's First 2nm Smartphone Processor
items.summary: Samsung introduced the Exynos 2600, the first 2nm smartphone processor featuring the company's largely in-house developed mobile GPU, targeting mid-range devices. This marks a significant advancement in mobile chip technology.[2]

items.title: TSMC Accelerates Arizona Fab Timeline Amid Global Shifts
items.summary: TSMC has sped up production at its second Arizona factory while Taiwan considers limits on advanced node exports. This move aims to bolster U.S. semiconductor manufacturing capacity.[2]

items.title: Qualcomm Acquires Alphawave Semi and Ventana Micro, Embraces RISC-V
items.summary: Qualcomm completed acquisitions of connectivity firm Alphawave Semi and RISC-V specialist Ventana Micro, signaling a strategic pivot to RISC-V architecture. The deals contributed to a sharp drop in Arm's market value.[2]

items.title: Amazon Confirms Five-Year Russian Cyberattack on AWS Customers
items.summary: Amazon revealed a prolonged Russian cyberattack targeting AWS customers over five years, highlighting ongoing security threats in cloud infrastructure.[1]

items.title: Microsoft 365 Faces Surge in Account Hacks Linked to China and Russia
items.summary: Microsoft reported a sharp increase in Microsoft 365 account hacks, with suspicions pointing to actors from China and Russia amid rising cybersecurity challenges.[1]

items.title: Apple Agrees to App Store Changes in Brazil and Europe, Appeals $115M Italian Fine
items.summary: Apple updated App Store policies to allow third-party stores and payments in Brazil while complying with EU rules, but is appealing a $115 million privacy fine in Italy.[1]

items.title: Amazon Announces Elimination of Over 14,000 Jobs
items.summary: Amazon confirmed layoffs exceeding 14,000 positions as part of corporate restructuring efforts.[1]
